snippet: Orascom, the Egyptian mobile-phone operator with an exclusive contract in North Korea, said last week that it now has more than 1 million subscribers in the Hermit Kingdom. So a slow-motion digital revolution seems to be taking place, if not an...
abstract: Orascom, the Egyptian mobile-phone operator with an exclusive contract in North Korea, said last week that it now has more than 1 million subscribers in the Hermit Kingdom. So a slow-motion digital revolution seems to be taking place, if not an actual revolution.

headline.main: Hello? Pyongyang? Can You Hear Me Now?
